Utterance: Hi there! It’s great to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Hi, Ellie! I’ve been okay. I actually got a call back for an interview!
That’s amazing! Congratulations! How do you feel about it?
I’m excited but also really nervous. It’s been a while since I’ve interviewed.
It’s completely normal to feel nervous. How are you preparing for the interview?
I’ve been reviewing common questions and practicing my answers. I want to make a good impression.
That’s a smart approach. Would you like to do a quick run-through of any specific questions you’re worried about?
Yes, I’m worried about the “What’s your biggest weakness?” question.
That’s a tricky one! A good strategy is to mention a real weakness but follow it up with how you’re working to improve it. Do you have a weakness in mind?
I think my biggest weakness is sometimes being too detail-oriented, which can slow me down.
That’s a great example! You can explain how you’ve been working on balancing attention to detail with efficiency.
I like that! It shows I’m self-aware and proactive.
Exactly! How do you feel about your overall preparation for the interview?
I feel more confident, especially with your help. I think I’m ready.
That’s wonderful! And how’s the housing search going? Have you found any new listings?
Yes! I visited a couple of places, and one of them felt really good. It had a nice vibe.
That’s exciting! What made it feel like a good fit for you?
The neighborhood seemed friendly, and it had a lot of natural light. I could really see myself living there.
That’s a great sign! Have you considered applying for it?
I’m thinking about it. I just want to make sure I can afford it first.
That’s wise. Have you had a chance to work on your budget yet?
Yes, I did! It helped me see that I could manage it if I get the job.
That’s fantastic! It sounds like you’re taking proactive steps towards your goals. How does it feel to have a clearer picture?
It feels empowering. I feel like I’m finally making progress.
That’s wonderful to hear! It’s important to celebrate those small victories. Is there anything else on your mind today?
I guess I’m just worried about how I’ll feel if I don’t get the job.
It’s normal to have those worries. Remember, each interview is a learning experience. You’re gaining skills that will help you in the future, regardless of the outcome.
That’s a good point. I need to keep reminding myself of that.
Absolutely! And remember to be kind to yourself during this process. You’re doing your best.
Thank you, Ellie. I appreciate your support.
You’re very welcome! I’m here to help. Let’s check in again after your interview and see how it went.
Sounds good! I’ll keep you posted.
I look forward to hearing all about it. Take care, and see you next time!
Goodbye!
Goodbye!
